title: StickyNote node: 'content' property default value truncated

metadata.affected_nodes: StickyNote (potentially other nodes with long string default values in properties)

description.problem: The 'default' value for the 'content' property in the StickyNote node is truncated in the extracted JSON, leading to loss of information.
description.impact: HIGH - Significant information loss for the 'default' value of a key property. Users relying on the extracted documentation would not see the full default content or the helpful guide link.
description.root_cause: The extraction logic for string default values in properties might have a character limit or an issue with parsing multi-line strings or strings containing special characters (like newlines or markdown formatting).
evidence: Source snippet: default: "## I'm a note \n**Double click** to edit me. [Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/sticky-notes/)
Command used to verify: jq '.properties[] | select(.name == "content") | .default' extracted_docs/stickynote_data.json and manual comparison with source.
description.fix_approach:
1. Review the extraction logic for string default values within properties. 
2. Ensure that the full string content, including special characters and multi-line text, is captured without truncation. 
3. Test with: StickyNote node. 
4. Expected result: The 'default' value for 'content' in 'stickynote_data.json' should match the source exactly. 
5. Validation command: jq '.properties[] | select(.name == "content") | .default' extracted_docs/stickynote_data.json should return the full string.
